Submodules¶

Stele.processing.processing_hsg.helper_functions module¶

Stele.processing.processing_hsg.helper_functions.fourier_prep(x_vals, y_vals, num=None)¶

This function will take a Nx2 array with unevenly spaced x-values and make them evenly spaced for use in fft-related things.

And remove nans!

Stele.processing.processing_hsg.helper_functions.gauss(x, *p)¶

Gaussian fit function.

Parameters

  • x (np.array, or int or float) – The independent variable

  • p (list of floats or ints) – [mean, area, width, y offset] to be unpacked

Returns

Depends on x, returns another np.array or float or int

Return type

type(x)

Stele.processing.processing_hsg.helper_functions.handle_nans(y_vals)¶

This function removes nans and replaces them with linearly interpolated values. It requires that the array maps from equally spaced x-values. Taken from Stack Overflow: “Interpolate NaN values in a numpy array”
